p.s: Gardening is a fun and rewarding hobby that will also offer self-satisfaction .
There â€™s nothing like planting a seed and watching it grow into a full plant .
Tropical gardening is not much different than any other types of gardening .
Plants still share the same basic needs : healthy soil , water , and proper fertilization .

list.item:
Research your area 's climates and plants that grow well there .
Find out what plants do well in the tropics and make sure they can withstand any difficulties they could face .
Research the native plants in your area .
Native plants tend to grow more successfully in your area as they can grow in every condition that your area gives .
They also can adapt to changes more easily than other plants .
Research your area 's weather conditions .
This way , you 'll be able to better assess your plants ' needs

Pick a location that provides for the necessities of your plants .
This one matters the most when the preparation is brought to mind .
You should assess the following :
The amount of sunlight exposure during the day .
The location must receive the right amount of sunlight exposure , depending on what kind of plants you want to grow .
Some plants need less sunlight while others require more .
The texture of the soil .
For the most part , plants do well in loamy , well-draining soil .
The fertility content of the soil , however , does depend on your plants .

item.s: Prepare the necessary materials .

You should have the following at hand :
Rake
Spade or shovel
Fertilizer
Water
Seeds ( purchase them from gardening stores or get seeds from fruits/existing plants )

list.item:
Prepare the area .
Remove any weeds and debris of any kind .
Till the soil for at least deep .
Work the fertilizer ( or the kitchen waste if you ca n't find fertilizer ) into the soil .
Rake the fertilizer all over the area .
Poke holes , about apart from each other .

item.s: Start planting .
Insert seeds into the holes .
Remember , the planting depth and space requirements may differ from one plant to another , so take them into consideration when doing this .
Among the major field crops , oats , wheat , and rye are sown , grasses and legumes are seeded , and maize and soybeans are planted .
Cover the seeds lightly with soil .
Water generously until germination .

list.item:
Apply
weed and feed
regularly .
This will keep weeds from germinating in your yard .
People and pets should stay away from the treatment areas during weed and feed application , and until the product 's dust settles .
Wear protective clothing including gloves , long sleeves , and long pants when you use weed and feed products .

item.s: Mulch the plants .
This will retain moisture and hinder the growth .
You can lay down dead leaves from trees nearby .
Soil amendment can also be used as mulch .

You should always be prepared for problems that may occur in the garden , such as :
Pests .
You can eliminate them by planting attractants for predacious creatures or by using organic pesticides .
Diseases .
You can eliminate them by having a schedule and keeping it consistent ( ex . a watering schedule ) .
Some diseases could infect and kill plants easily , so getting rid of the problem at an earlier stage will ensure your peace of mind .
Excessive heat .
Although plants generally like the sun , they can get overwhelmed if they 're being exposed to it for too long .
Covering them or determining the perfect location can defeat the excessive heat of the sun .
Stress .
Plants can get stressed when crowded , provided the least amount of their needs or the wrong requirements for them to survive .

This can be solved by
planning
carefully before beginning the plantation .
Enjoy your wonderful garden !
Following these steps will ensure you a happier experience and a bountiful garden .
Do n't use any chemicals on your plants .
This will harm and kill plants and other insects that are helping your garden flourish .
